text: Come as you are. There is room for you here.
author: Rumi-inspired

text: Even after many wrong turns, you can still begin again.
author: Rumi-inspired

text: Let hope be the road you return to.
author: Rumi-inspired

text: Your heart doesn’t need permission to start over.
author: Rumi-inspired

text: When love calls, loosen your grip and follow.
author: Rumi-inspired

text: Trust what quietly pulls you toward life.
author: Rumi-inspired

text: Your instincts are a lantern—walk by their glow.
author: Rumi-inspired

text: Beyond labels and debates, the soul knows its field.
author: Rumi-inspired

text: Choose the place where kindness and courage meet.
author: Rumi-inspired

text: Make your aim the space where opposites soften.
author: Rumi-inspired

text: If asked what you do, say: I practice beauty.
author: Rumi-inspired

text: Create something gentle inside an ordinary day.
author: Rumi-inspired

text: Close your eyes and let the sky rearrange you.
author: Rumi-inspired

text: Let wonder bloom—quietly, without applause.
author: Rumi-inspired

text: When the inside brightens, the outside becomes clear.
author: Rumi-inspired

text: Love teaches without lectures.
author: Rumi-inspired

text: Your chest can be a dance floor for joy.

text: Let your art be how you say thank you.

text: Set your life alight with what matters.

text: Stand near people who warm your courage.

text: Carry light inside you and you’ll find the door.

text: Home is a direction, not a place.

text: Breathe in laughter; exhale love.

text: Love long, but love honestly.

text: Silence is not empty; it’s full of music.

text: Go where everything sounds like belonging.

text: Let prayer be the posture of your attention.

text: You have beauty you haven’t met yet.

text: The middle way is often the kind way.

text: Wisdom walks without showing off.

text: Rise and dance—gently, even when it’s hard.

text: Let your heart break open, not shut down.

text: There is a morning inside you—invite it.

text: You are larger than your fear makes you feel.

text: You move with the universe when you move with love.

text: Pour out yesterday; drink today slowly.

text: Your deepest desire is often your truest teacher.

text: When you listen to your soul, small cravings quiet down.

text: When you’re ready for joy, the earth feels it.

text: Let your life become a yes.

text: What matters most: do what your soul keeps asking.

text: Observe the world like it’s speaking directly to you.

text: Be still long enough to feel the artistry moving.

text: Your rough edges can shine when loved.

text: To know love, become love in your smallest actions.

text: Love connects you to everything worth meeting.

text: Without love, time feels like it forgets you.

text: Let your heart lead when maps fail.

text: Life begins at the center of your own tenderness.

text: Answer what ignites you—even quietly.

text: Separation is sometimes a trick of the mind.

text: Longing can end when you finally arrive inside yourself.

text: First comes the storm of love; then the guide appears.

text: This road is yours—walk it in your own rhythm.

text: Love can outlast fear, habit, and history.
author: Rumi-inspired

text: Your love can lift you above old versions of you.

text: It’s your turn to be refined by fire, not destroyed.

text: You are richer than you realize—look again.

text: Sometimes the world looks lost when you’ve lost yourself.

text: Union makes the questioner disappear.

text: Stop thinking small; think true.

text: What you keep chasing may already live in you.

text: Look inward; your universe is not far away.

text: Worry is loud; love is steady.

text: A true lover is not owned by labels.

text: If love hurts, it’s shaping you—not punishing you.

text: An intellect can be clever; a soul can be free.

text: Lose yourself in what’s real and you’ll find yourself.

text: On the path of love, the wise and the wild can agree.

text: You worry too much—come back to the breath.

text: You are the strand that can connect you back to you.

text: You’ve seen the fall; now watch the rise.

text: As you walk, the way unfolds beneath your feet.

text: Do whatever brings you to life, then. Follow your own fascinations, obsessions, and compulsions. Trust them. Create whatever causes a revolution in your heart.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: The universe buries strange jewels deep within us all, and then stands back to see if we can find them.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: Be the weirdo who dares to enjoy.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: You can measure your worth by your dedication to your path, not by your successes or failures.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: Done is better than good.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: A creative life is an amplified life. It’s a bigger life, a happier life, an expanded life, and a hell of a lot more interesting life. Living in this manner—continually and stubbornly bringing forth the jewels that are hidden within you—is a fine art, in and of itself.”
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: So this, I believe, is the central question upon which all creative living hinges: Do you have the courage to bring forth the treasures that are hidden within you?
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: It seems to me that the less I fight my fear, the less it fights back. If I can relax, fear relaxes, too.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: It’s a simple and generous rule of life that whatever you practice, you will improve at.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: Argue for your limitations and you get to keep them.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: It might have been done before, but it hasn’t been done by you!
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: Own your disappointment, acknowledge it for what it is, and move on.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: If you’re alive, you’re a creative person.”
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: Ideas are driven by a single impulse: to be made manifest.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: creative entitlement simply means believing that you are allowed to be here, and that—merely by being here—you are allowed to have a voice and a vision of your own.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: Create whatever causes a revolution in your heart. The rest of it will take care of itself.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: The answer is always the same: 'More wonder, please.'
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: As long as I'm still moving in that direction---toward wonder--then I know I will always be fine in my soul, which is where it counts. And since creativity is still the most effective way for me to access wonder, I choose it.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: We are all just beginners here, and we shall all die beginners.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: But never delude yourself into believing that you require someone else’s blessing (or even their comprehension) in order to make your own creative work.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: failure has a function. It asks you whether you really want to go on making things.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: Whatever you do, try not to dwell too long on your failures. You don’t need to conduct autopsies on your disasters.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: Fear is always triggered by creativity, because creativity asks you to enter into realms of uncertain outcome. This is nothing to be ashamed of. It is, however, something to be dealt with.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: Because the truth is, I believe that creativity is a force of enchantment—not entirely human in its origins.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: your life is short and rare and amazing and miraculous, and you want to do really interesting things and make really interesting things while you’re still here.”
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: Anyhow, what else are you going to do with your time here on earth—not make things? Not do interesting stuff? Not follow your love and your curiosity?
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: Create whatever causes a revolution in your heart.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: the clock is ticking, and the world is spinning, and we simply do not have time anymore to think so small.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: At some point, you really just have to finish your work and release it as is-if only so you can go on and make other things with a glad and determined heart.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: Go be whomever you want to be, then. Do whatever you want to do. Pursue whatever fascinates you and brings you to life.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: You want to write a book? Make a song? Direct a movie? Decorate pottery? Learn a dance? Explore a new land? You want to draw a penis on your wall? Do it. Who cares? It’s your birthright as a human being, so do it with a cheerful heart. (I mean, take it seriously, sure—but don’t take it seriously.) Let inspiration lead you wherever it wants to lead you.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: Gratitude, always. Always, gratitude.”
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: And maybe it’s like that with every important aspect of your life. Whatever it is you are pursuing, whatever it is you are seeking, whatever it is you are creating, be careful not to quit too soon.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: Learning how to endure your disappointment and frustration is part of the job o fa creative person...Frustration is not an interruption of your process; frustration is the process.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: Your creative work is not your baby; if anything, you are its baby.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: I have watched so many other people murder their creativity by demanding that their art pay the bills.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: Your art not only doesn’t have to be original, in other words; it also doesn’t have to be important.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: Embrace the creativity and don't care about the result. It's better to be a beginner till the end of the life than waiting forever to be perfect.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: Don’t rush through the experiences and circumstances that have the most capacity to transform you.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: The work wants to be made, and it wants to be made through you.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: Only when we are at our most playful can divinity finally get serious with us.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: Love over suffering, always.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: The essential ingredients for creativity remain exactly the same for everybody: courage, enchantment, permission, persistence, trust—and those elements are universally accessible.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: You don't need to conduct autopsies on your disasters.

text: There are so many good reasons to stop complaining if you want to live a more creative life.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

text: Q: What is creativity? A: The relationship between a human being and the mysteries of inspiration.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert
